page.title: 04DANBURY COMMON
page.content: DANBURY COMMON-NATIONAL TRUST PARK The Lord of the Manor,{Lord {Fitzwalter,}owned the common, which was used for grazing cattle and sheep. He donated 22 acres to the{National {Trust.}There are 5 types of land on the common - heath,grass,scrub,wood and marsh. Every 2 years the bracken is cut down so that the heather can live. Many different flowers grow on the{heath,}including tormentil and sheep sorrel.{Grassland}is an open area on which broomflower, stitchery, gorse, blackthorn and dogrose thrive.{ {Scrubland}is an area containing bushes,hedges and a few flowers, while in the{woodland}live foxes,badgers and rabbits.{Marshy}areas consist of rushes,sedges and reeds. Orchids,frogs and adders all live in the watery marshland. Butterflies and birds are to be found in all areas of the common
